entry.title: Move and simplify DocumentMarkerPainter::ComputeTextPaintStyleFrom
entry.content:

other types. Move the helper to highlight_painter.cc and merge in the

handling of SVG text into it.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix assert in mac_sdk.gni for Blink builds
entry.content:
An assert in mac_sdk.gni is failing when using the app_ext toolchain.



This ensures that mac_sdk.gni isn't used for iOS builds, and updates

the assert in mac_sdk.gni to remove an existing exception.

entry.title: [signin][tests] Identity test utils don't use unknown access point by default
entry.content:
The main change is in identity_test_utils.h



ACCESS_POINT_UNKNOWN is not something that is used in production, and

triggers edge cases and errors. In particular it does not count as an

explicit signin for Uno.



This CL uses a more conventional access point, to match what is

happening in production.



As a result, UNO gets enabled in many more tests.

Some of them are testing pre-UNO behavior, and for those tests, the

UNO feature is explicitly disabled.



Change-Id: Idf379dfe307af289e7099b0850c017981c6eab42

Cq-Do-Not-Cancel-Tryjobs: true

Validate-Test-Flakiness: skip

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5300960

Reviewed-by: Victor Vianna

entry.title: [Autofill] Eliminate AutofillDriverIOS::HandleParsedForms()
entry.content:
This CL replaces AutofillDriverIOS::HandleParsedForms() with an

AutofillManager::Observer of OnAfterFormsSeen().



This is equivalent because HandleParsedForms() each have only one

callsite, right after each other. Their only difference is that

HandleParsedForms() is only called only if `!forms.empty()`.

The new observer exactly replicates this behaviour.



The reason for eliminating HandleParsedForms() is that there is

no way to implement for non-iOS Chrome because FormStructures aren't

visible in the renderer.



Bug: 40276395

Change-Id: I453d175fba2824368beafbfb49ac079c872b7348

entry.title: Collect metrics on how often plus addresses would suppress Autocomplete.
entry.content:
This CL attempts to simulate how often Autocomplete suggestions would

get suppressed by Plus Address suggestions if they were fully rolled

out. The metric will only be meaningful as long as only a negligible

portion of clients have Plus Addresses enabled and is therefore

targeted for removal later this year. This is reflected in the

expiry date of the metric.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Add extension API to set tab title for a full-page PDF
entry.content:
Tab title is updated only when title is set in a top-level document.

For OOPIF viewer, extension document is not a top-level document.

As a result, setting the title using document.title is not honoured.



This CL introduces a new extension API setPdfDocumentTitle to update

PDF tab title for full-page PDFs using WebContents::UpdateTitleForEntry.

entry.title: Include listed elements of nested forms in CollectListedElements.
entry.content:
In principle, the HTML spec prohibits nested
s inside the same

tree scope. In practice, it can still happen:

- Pages can dynamically create a form element and append it as a child

to another form element.

- Pages can have HTML source code that has sufficiently many

mismatching element tags that the renderer reacts by nesting forms.

This is the case for some of Autofill's heuristic tests that consist

of HTML from real web sites.



This CL adjusts HTMLFormElement::CollectListedElements to also include

form control elements that are associated with forms that are a

descendant of the form for which we are gathering the listed elements.

It adds these form control elements to the list that already includes

form control elements inside shadow DOM, whose sole user is Autofill.



The changes made in this CL are gated behind the feature

kAutofillIncludeFormElementsInShadowDom.



Bug: 40204601

Change-Id: Ic63162d7978573d03430b35ded3302c8869aae22

entry.title: GPUExternalTexture 1-copy path handles non-YUV format CPU backed frame
entry.content:
GPUExternalTexture 1-copy path uses

PaintCanvasVideoRenderer::CopyVideoFrameToSharedImage() to do 1-copy

uploading. However, this function requires video frame is multiplanar

format.



But some video frames (e.g. user created webcodec video frame) are

CPU backed data with non-multiplanar format(e.g. PIXEL_FORMAT_ABGR).



This CL adds DrawVideoFrameIntoResourceProvider() back to handle these

cases.

entry.title: Revert "Use ReadData() instead of BeginReadData()"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e3a93f5f9e142d574afa545a0423c6b5fc27a43d.



Reason for revert: net::DraninableIOBuffer introduced crashes on Canary. crbug.com/327694512



Original change's description:

> Use ReadData() instead of BeginReadData()

>

> This is a preliminary change to split ReadAndWrite() method in

> ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient.

>

> At a high-level, the current ReadAndWrite() operations are following:

> 1. Begin read operation.

> 2. Write data to another buffer.

> 3. End read operation.

>

> This operation requires the read data pipe API call twice (1 and 3), and

> that makes the function separation difficult.

>

> This CL updates ReadAndWrite() not to read data via two phase approach,

> but use ReadData() and store the buffer data in the class.

>

> After this CL, the read operation is completed at once, and the new data

> won't be stored unless all buffered data in the member are consumed.

>

> Bug: 40943349

> Change-Id: I6e5a4bac3d0829d7122a1a750805bb0c13abe9ec

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5330307

> Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266872}



Bug: 40943349

Change-Id: Ia37d695e78f53c709752c75d25b5db6bc3449431

entry.title: WebUI: Remove some exceptions for definitions in validate_tsconfig
entry.content:
(1) Remove third_party/lit exception as it appears to be unnecessary

(2) Remove tools/typescript/definitions exception, so that UIs are

required to list all definitions from this folder that they are

using. For all UIs other than the ones using the dependency mapping,

this fixes a potential build issue as these targets were depending

on files but not listing them as inputs for gn.

(3) Only a couple of UIs were actually using the dependency mapping for

tools/typescript/definitions introduced in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5315610

so revert most of this change, in favor of the exception removal

mentioned in (2). The approach in (2) is preferred because most

untracked dependencies in tools/typescript/definitions came from

.d.ts files importing other .d.ts files, rather than from imports

accessed via path_mappings.



Bug: 326005022

entry.title: media/gpu/vaapi: Reduce max simultaneous decoders on Grunt to 10
entry.content:
VaapiVideoDecoder has the notion of having a maximum number of

concurrent decoders, currently 16. For AMD Radeon R5, a.k.a. Stoney

Ridge as those in Chromebook "grunt", this is too high, and should

be no larger than 10.



This CL moves the calculation of said maximum to VaapiWrapper (by

default 16, Grunt 10) and adds a private GetMaxNumDecoderInstances()

for convenience and for the new unit test. With this, the

Create/ForVideoCodec() will fail (returning a nullptr VaapiWrapper)

when the threshold is reached, and afterwards and while there's too

many active decodes.



The querying point also moves from VaapiVideoDecoder::Create() to

Initialize() since it's at that moment that resources are acquired --

actually they might even be acquired later, and not upon the

VaInitialize() or VaapiWrapper::Initialize() calls in

VaapiWrapper::Create(), but it's certainly an improvement from ToT.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/mojo/services/mojo_video_decoder_service.cc;l=230-235;drc=581b9e8403fdba9f33cc315c56180f841407c86b



Bug: b:266003084

Change-Id: I51e764a74fab5f81384ea923d1fcb06fc1a6ea2a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5304614

Reviewed-by: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

entry.title: Revert "Split read and write in ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 71a486e130f369c12f05b0be4385bf7580edc43d.



Reason for revert: net::DraninableIOBuffer introduced crashes on Canary. crbug.com/327694512



Original change's description:

> Split read and write in ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient

>

> This CL removes `ReadAndWrite()` and `ReadAndTwoPhaseWrite()`, and

> updates to call `Read()` and `Write()` (or, `TwoPhaseWrite()`)

> separately.

>

> After this CL, the read operation is called only when the read data pipe

> becomes readable (or the peer closed), and the write data pipe becomes

> writable. This would improve the code base that mojo data pipe APIs to

> be called in an appropriate timing.

>

> Also this CL updates `RaceNetworkRequestReadBufferManager::ReadData()`

> to be called only when the remaining unconsumed buffer does not exist

> for the simplicity.

>

> Bug: 40943349

> Change-Id: I78495ff75f96e7306f3920843b5ec3be24ea2d7d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5332231

> Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266937}

entry.title: WebUI: Prevent firing erroneous '-changed' events from CrLitElement.
entry.content:
In some cases, Lit's changedProperties dictionary holds entries for

properties where both previous and new values are 'undefined'. Firing

'-changed' events for such cases was causing some Polymer 2-way

bindings parents to be broken.



For example this is fixing an issue caused by cr-input's Lit migration,

affecting Settings' "add address" dialog.

entry.title: Reland "[PWA] Fix icons for Mac universal links in intent picker bubble, change behavior"
entry.content:
This CL fixes the flakiness in the old CL by waiting for the intent

picker updates to finish before verifying if the app icon has loaded.



See https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5335055/1..2 for

more information.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[PWA] Fix icons for Mac universal links in intent picker bubble, change behavior"

>

> This reverts commit 5ec5a9aa345c14adcfd670591fc3f7a85a326c36.

>

> Reason for revert: test is consistently failing on mac13-arm64-rel-tests:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac13-arm64-rel-tests/17998/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FIntentPickerInteractiveUiTest.ShowUniversalLinkAppInIntentChip+VHash%3Ab13444d719a560a0

>

> [24248:259:0229/113017.660436:FATAL:bad_variant_access.cc(44)] Check failed: false. Bad variant access

>

> 7 interactive_ui_tests 0x0000000102d5fa44 absl::variant_internal::ThrowBadVariantAccess() + 36

> 8 interactive_ui_tests 0x00000001026ed31c WebRtcMediaDevicesInteractiveUITest::MediaDeviceInfo* std::__Cr::vector>::__push_back_slow_path(WebRtcMediaDevicesInteractiveUITest::MediaDeviceInfo const&) + 0

> 9 interactive_ui_tests 0x0000000108d6b330 ui::ImageModel::operator==(ui::ImageModel const&) const + 0

> 10 interactive_ui_tests 0x00000001028c3fbc IntentPickerInteractiveUiTest_ShowUniversalLinkAppInIntentChip_Test::RunTestOnMainThread() + 884

>

>

> Original change's description:

> > [PWA] Fix icons for Mac universal links in intent picker bubble, change behavior

> >

> > This CL does the following:

> >

> > Fixes the issue where icons on the intent picker bubble would not be shown due to non-integration with the Mac system for apps with

> > universal links. This is done by caching the obtained mac

> > information in the WebAppsIntentPickerDelegate for use when

> > looking for an app icon for Mac apps. On a side note, this brings

> > the behavior of the Mac apps closer to PWAs by making the final

> > callback be posted on the task runner instead of running it

> > synchronously.

> >

> > Brings the behavior for Mac apps closer to PWAs, where:

> > a. If there is only 1 Mac app available, then the app icon shows

> > up in the intent picker bubble if link capturing is enabled. Clicking

> > on it directly launches the app instead of opening the bubble.

> > b. Otherwise, the bubble opens with all icons loaded.

> >

> > Also modifies the default link capturing interactive ui tests to

> > verify this behavior.

> >

> > Intent Chip screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BCrqRdQ6EFEpmr7

> > Bubble fix screenshot:

> > https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3Ly8MCwXBsDTv5W

> >

> > Bug: 325743930, crbug.com/1412856

entry.title: Switch to GetFocusDelegate() in GetFocusableArea()
entry.content:
This was part of the DialogNewFocusBehavior feature, but it appears

to fix another delegatesFocus bug (crbug.com/324112201). This CL

enables this part of the behavior, which is to call

GetFocusDelegate() instead of FindFocusableElementInShadowHost(),

in Element::GetFocusableArea(). Those differ slightly in how they

handle `delegatesFocus`.



This change is gated behind a killswitch, and I added a test that

fails without this CL.

entry.title: IDB: shard backing stores across threads, part 2
entry.content:
In this step, ContextImpl => BucketContext flows are made async.

This is achieved with manual `PostTask()` (and friends) calls in

order to support toggling the feature flag. In the final state

it will be more ergonomic to use SequenceBound, but switching to

SequenceBound is not possible while the code still needs to access

the raw pointer (in tests that have not yet been updated and in

production code where sharding is not yet enabled).

entry.title: [DNR] Erase matched request actions when extension is disabled
entry.content:
This CL fixes a crash/bug that can result in the following series of

actions



1. A request is about to be made and extension A matches some modify

headers actions (response headers).

2. extension A is unloaded.

3. The request's response with headers is received. A's matched modify

headers actions are applied.



^At step 3, a crash occurs as an event which records when DNR actions

have been executed expects the extension which matched the action to

still be enabled. Even if this doesn't crash, the behavior is incorrect

as the request should not be modified by an extension after it is no

longer enabled.



Fix: when an extension is disabled, remove its matched DNR actions

from requests so they will not be evaluated.



Bug: 40072083

Change-Id: I7318cd50ee7b0cec395b90f480fd45af8818287a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5255739

entry.title: Refactor PersistentProto
entry.content:
This CL refactors PersistentProto by achieving the following things:



1. In persistent_proto.h, hide `ReadStatus` and `WriteStatus` in an

internal namespace. Because PersistentProto users should not be

interested in these low-level details. Actually, users never use

`ReadStatus` or `WriteStatus` in the product code.



2. Use the helper classes in base/callback_list.h to replace the

std::vector of callbacks.



3. Rename `OnRead` to `OnInit`. Also, update the class comment

correspondingly.



4. Remove unnecessary usage of `base::WeakPtrFactory` in the code

of PersistentProto users where the protos are owned by users.



This CL should not bring any noticeable difference.

entry.title: Disable flaky FileUtilTest.PreReadFile* test cases
entry.content:
Several test cases for base::PreReadFile() became flaky on the 32-bit

Windows Chrome builder after https://crrev.com/1265553 landed. The issue

may be that the Windows prefetch API can fail under memory pressure,

which can be higher when the OS is 32-bit. Prior to

https://crrev.com/1265553, there was a fallback path intended for

Windows 7. That fallback path may have been masking these failures all

along.



Without an immediate solution, just conditionally disable the known

failing test cases for now to make the affected builder greener. Along

the way, change all the PreReadFile tests to remove underscores, as

GoogleTest reserves underscores for its own use.



Bug: 327582285

entry.title: Reland "Use the end position without increasing the offset for a new line"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 028fd39e54cf5f12f9860d3a3e9073c230d27991.

It removes updating //third_party/blink/web_tests/TestExpectations

from the original CL since it doesn't affect the existing tests.



Original change's description:

> Use the end position without increasing the offset for a new line

>

> This CL doesn't increase the end offset to get the range for a new

> line character at RangeForParagraphSplittingTextNodesIfNeeded() and it

> fixes duplicating texts on indenting a pre block since the end position

> points a new line character correctly.

> If it increases the offset, the position doesn't point a new line

> character and InRenderedText() returns false. When VisiblePosition for

> the position that has a new line character is created, it points the

> next node and clones the next node together.

>

entry.title: [Extensions] Introduce a ChromeExtensionsRendererAPIProvider
entry.content:
The ExtensionsRendererAPIProvider was introduced as a way for layers

outside of //extensions to add API-specific bits to the extensions

system. It was originally introduced for the controlled frame work, but

with the intention that we could use it in other places to more fully

align with the pattern used in the other (browser and common) layers.



This CL introduces a new ChromeExtensionsRendererAPIProvider and

moves the source map registrations that were previously handled in

the //chrome layer's implementation of the DispatcherDelegate into the

new provider instead. Followups will continue moving bits into the

new API provider.



This CL should have no behavior change.

entry.title: [zoom] Adjust line-height and width when the effective zoom changes
entry.content:
Based on CL:5302760 by chrishtr@.



In Blink, lengths are stored on the ComputedStyle with "premultiplied

zoom", meaning that for e.g. width:20px;zoom:200%, the width is stored

as "40". Currently, we do not account for this during inheritance:

we inherit that "40" as-is, even if the effective zoom of the element

we're inheriting into is not the same. Issue 9397 [1] clarified that

this is not correct, and therefore we need to adjust our zoomed values

when inheriting.



This CL solves this problem by using our existing code paths

for creating the computed CSSValue (which already does unzooming)

and for applying that CSSValue onto a ComputedStyle (which already

does zooming).



We need two things for this to work:



1. Special behavior in Longhand::ApplyInherit, which detects if

the effective zoom changed, and if so, inherits via the computed

CSSValue path instead of the regular ComputedStyle-to-ComputedStyle

path. However, Longhand::ApplyInherit is only reached if an explicit

inherit/unset exists in the cascade, but we also need to make the

adjustment for *inherited* properties (e.g. line-height).

Therefore:

2. During cascade expansion, if the effective zoom changes vs. the

parent zoom, we insert explicit 'unset' values at the bottom

of the cascade. This ensures that we always reach ApplyInherit

for affected properties.



This CL only enables the zoom adjustment for one inherited property

(line-height), and one non-inherited property (width) to establish

the pattern. Future CLs will incrementally add the 'affected_by_zoom'

flag to the relevant properties.



Bug: 40946858



[1] https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9397



Change-Id: Iab4dd978143e56264a5c78377055ecbb0363b276

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5323090

Commit-Queue: Chris Harrelson

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1267277}

entry.title: [AsyncSB] Use alternate referrer chain fetch when pending URL not found
entry.content:
This CL modifies the referrer chain fetch for URT lookups so that if

IdentifyReferrerChainByPendingEventURL is unable to find the navigation

event, IdentifyReferrerChainByEventURL is used instead. This is needed

for async checks because the referrer chain fetching may occur after the

URL is no longer pending.



Some details:

- A new method IdentifyReferrerChainByEventURL is introduced that calls

into a method of the same name but does not require passing through

the event_outermost_main_frame_id. This is for dependency reasons --

we want to pass through a default value for this but that requires

dependencies on //content.

- This CL uses the web_contents to fetch the tab_id and pass that

through to IdentifyReferrerChainByEventURL. This is to more

accurately identify the appropriate referrer chain. This is

implemented by threading through the tab_id from consumers of

SafeBrowsingUrlCheckerImpl.

- The fallback method is only called when async checks is enabled.



New histograms:

- SafeBrowsing.RT.EventUrlReferrerChainFetchSucceeded

- SafeBrowsing.RT.EventUrlReferrerChainFetchSucceeded.Consumer

- SafeBrowsing.RT.EventUrlReferrerChainFetchSucceeded.Enterprise

entry.title: [zoom] Avoid CascadeOrigin::kNone for @page and FormattedTest
entry.content:
The special style resolutions for @page and FormattedText

do not particularly care about the origin of their declarations

and therefore used CascadeOrigin::kNone. However, for standardizing

zoom, we need to free up CascadeOrigin::kNone for something else

(explicit defaulting).



Therefore, this CL replaces all current uses of CascadeOrigin::kNone

with CascadeOrigin::kAuthor/CascadeOrigin::kUserAgent.



Note that BeginAddingAuthorRulesForTreeScope must be called before

we're allowed to add declarations in the author origin, but this is

purely to satisfy the API. It has no effect on the behavior in this

case.



This CL allows @page !important declarations within the user agent

origin to be weighted correctly in the cascade, although this has

no observable effect at the moment, since we have no such

UA declarations.



Bug: 40946858

Change-Id: I4296e0daba0cf9a08acf934b52cf6687cf836752

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331047

entry.title: [mullet m3] Only log credit card manual fallback on non credit card fields
entry.content:
manual_fallback_metrics.h is only supposed to handle usages from a field

that is classified differently from the target filling product (i.e M3).

This CL makes sure that this is the case for CC fallback (we already do

this for addresses).



It also fixed a crash inside manual_fallback_metrics.h, this is because

it checks that an acceptance event can only happen if the entry was

shown. The current code does not record entry being shown, but records

it being accepted, which is a bug.



I am going to cover this case with a text in a follow up CL, for now

I want to fix the crash.

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Remove /accountManager route under revamp
entry.content:
When the OsSettingsRevampWayfinding feature is enabled, there is no

account manager subpage and thus /accountManager is not a valid route.

The account manager info is up-leveled to the top-level accounts page in

this case. This CL Removes this route from existing under the revamp.

This will prevent blank pages from showing when the /accountManager

route is visited, and instead redirect users to the homepage.

entry.title: Use exact values to get exactly-matching test results.
entry.content:
The values originally used in this test for the Perlin noise

frequency (0.025, 0.1) are not exact values in binary floating

point. For instance, 0.025 becomes 0x3ccccccd, or perhaps

0x3ccccccc, depending on how the number is parsed.



We now use numbers which are round in both base 2 and base 10,

and are roughly similar to the original values. For instance,

0.025 has been replaced by 0.03125, which is exactly 0x3d000000.

Visually, this slightly changes the size of the noise ripples

but as a test, it is not meaningfully different otherwise.

entry.title: immersive fullscreen: fix modal sheet behavior
entry.content:
AppKit ignores fullscreen toggle and close window requests when the

browser window is presenting a sheet. Currently in immersive fullscreen

sheets can be attached to browser window descendants, which do not

trigger the desired ignore behavior. Having sheets attached to

descendant windows also causes issues with z-ordering, see 40282144.



This CL attaches modal sheets to the browser window when in immersive

fullscreen. This resolves the fullscreen toggle and close issue as well

as the z-order issue. Nice!



Change-Id: I52eecd4b9ecf87aaf3fb65cd2fdf0e08f090fc8a

Bug: 40282144,327244286,327245905

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331933

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

Reviewed-by: Keren Zhu

Commit-Queue: Tom Burgin

entry.title: Use a clang plugin to emit and filter -Werror=unsafe-buffer-usage
entry.content:
Part 2 of 2 for "Allow incremental adoption of -Wunsafe-buffer-usage

at a per-file (either header or source file) granularity."



A key difficulty of spanification is that of incremental application

of the -Wunsafe-buffer-usage warning:

* First, textual includes mean that it's not possible to turn on the

warning for a header file only. It has to be enabled for a cc file

at a time.

* Then, enabling it for a cc file also transitively applies it to every

header it touches.

* And, enabling it on separate cc files requires splitting up our GN

build targets quite awkwardly, and will require a huge amount of

churn.



Clang itself does not provide a way to specify a warning should be

enabled only for certain files (crbug.com/41497066).



In https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5323341

we introduced the 'unsafe-buffers' plugin, which is able to apply

-Wunsafe-buffer-usage at the individual file level. In this CL, we

enable use of the plugin, and remove other existing mechanisms.



We add a list of checked file-path prefixes in

//build/config/unsafe_buffers_paths.txt which are read by the plugin

so that individual headers, cc files, and eventually directories

can have the warning enabled for them in an incremental manner

without requiring changes to the plugin or clang rolls.



In order to rebuild targets when the paths change, the path prefixes

file is added to the `inputs` set in GN for every C/C++ target.

However Reclient does not respect `inputs` for C/C++. It must for

Rust, to support `include!()`, and it will need to in the future to

support `#embed` in C. A workaround is added for this file in

//build/config/rbe.gni that just sticks the file in the command

line to rewrapped explicitly, passing it as `-inputs`. See

crbug.com/326584510 for this Reclient bug.



We remove the UNSAFE_BUFFERS_INCLUDE_BEGIN and

UNSAFE_BUFFERS_INCLUDE_END macros which were used to wrap header

includes and exclude them from unsafe-buffers checks as they

no longer provide additional value. Headers will only be checked

if they are opted in through the unsafe-buffers plugin.



And we remove the -Wunsafe-buffer-usage command line argument

from cflags as we use the plugin to do this job now. One day when

the codebase is clean, we can turn this warning on globally. The

dream.



Bug: 40284755, 41497066, 326584510

Change-Id: I03c43c2a6ab5552f58c6fcd0cb885ad2ce1460d7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5324046

Commit-Queue: danakj

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1267242}

entry.title: [Blob URL] Remove Storage.Blob.RegisterURLTime* metrics
entry.content:
We added these metrics to investigate differences between

RegisterURL calls when storage partitioning support is

both enabled and disabled, but analysis of the metrics

so few differences. These metrics recently expired, so

removing them.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Storage.Blob.RegisterURLTimeWithoutPartitioningSupport]=No longer needed.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Storage.Blob.RegisterURLTimeWithPartitioningSupport.Worker]=No longer needed.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Storage.Blob.RegisterURLTimeWithPartitioningSupport.Frame]=No longer needed.



Fixed: 41489673

Bug: 40062699

Change-Id: I287da6c4b171c02c3ae0e4cdb738793ecd0848d0

entry.title: Shared Storage: Allow perf test xvfb option to find available server num
entry.content:
We copy the short xvfb script from py_utils in catapult to the new

utils module in tools/perf/contrib/shared_storage so that we can

insert logic to find an available server number in the case that the

default is already in use.



This allows us to avoid an error when trying to use the xvfb option

e.g. in two terminals at once, or after the previous use ended in

an exception and so failed to properly terminate the xvfb process.



(Note that in the latter example above, manual cleanup is possible.)



Bug: 1516507,1218540

Change-Id: Ide742791c0782695faa62ea61c2e97258c729d0b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5332153

Reviewed-by: John Chen

Commit-Queue: Cammie Smith Barnes

Reviewed-by: Yao Xiao
